item.title: Human feces and vomit still uncleared, 15th November
item.description:
I made a report yesterday which supposedly got “resolved” despite the human feces and remnants of vomit still there. This is hazardous and extremely unpleasant for residents and passers by. Please actually clear this and make sure this alley is cleaned.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mills Court, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The parked car block the pavement and the restaurant., 15th November
item.description:
Please see the attached photograph showing that this car (Registration number CF55 HVO) has been parking on the pedestrian pavement often and sometimes overnight and for a few days. It blocked the entrance to the building and the restaurant. It is a health and safety concern as well as a breach of the Highway Code rule 244. Since 1974, Highway Code rule 244 has stated that drivers "MUST NOT park partially or wholly on the pavement in London and should not do so elsewhere unless signs permit it." The key things to note here are the words must not and should not. In London and Scotland, you must not park on the pavement, this must indicating there is legislation behind this rule, and the car owner could receive a fine for breaking it. I would appreciate it if the parking team could do something about it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Peckham Road, Camberwell, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet
